metadata.title: CVE-2023-52788 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:i915/perf: Fix NULL deref bugs with drm_dbg() calls When i915 perfinterface is not available dereferencing it will lead to NULL dereferences.As returning -ENOTSUPP is pretty clear return when perf interface is notavailable. [tursulin: added stable tag] (cherry picked from commit36f27350ff745bd228ab04d7845dfbffc177a889)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
